title: Force exerted on a box moving around in a circle

content.question: A block is attached to the end of a string and initially moves at a constant speed in a horizontal circle of constant radius, as shown. The radius is then increased slowly while the speed remains the same. Which of the following graphs best represents the force exerted on the block by the string as a function of the radius?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Radius,” the vertical axis is labeled “Force,” and no values are indicated along them. The line begins just above and to the right of the origin, and slants upward and to the right until it ends high above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Radius,” the vertical axis is labeled “Force,” and no values are indicated along them. The curve begins just above and to the right of the origin, and moves upward and to the right at an increasing rate until it ends high above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The horizontal axis is labeled “Radius,” the vertical axis is labeled “Force,” and no values are indicated along them. The line begins high above the horizontal axis and just to the right of the vertical axis, and slants downward and to the right until it ends just above the horizontal axis, far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Radius,” the vertical axis is labeled “Force,” and no values are indicated along them. The curve begins high above the horizontal axis and just to the right of the vertical axis, and moves downward and to the right at a decreasing rate. It levels off as it approaches the horizontal axis and ends just above the horizontal axis, far to the right of the vertical axis.
